Yes, involving local businesses is a great way to spread awareness about the bake sale competition and the cause it supports. Here are some tips on how to effectively promote your event and cause:

1. Social media: Use social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to promote your event. Share photos and posts announcing the event, and create hashtags to make it easier for people to find the fundraiser online.

2. Flyers and Posters: Print flyers, posters, and other promotional materials to distribute throughout the local businesses and the local community, including libraries, schools, and community centers.

3. Local News or Media: Reach out to local news or media outlets, and submit a press release about the event. They might be interested in featuring your event or cause, especially if it has a compelling story to tell.

4. Partner with Local Businesses: Partner with local businesses or organizations who share the same values or causes, and ask them to help promote your event or donate prizes for a raffle or auction.

5. Engage with Influencers: Identify local social media influencers who can help promote your event with their followers. They also might be able to attend the event and document everything for their audience.

6. Spread the Word to friends and family: Encourage your supporters and participants to share information about the event with their friends and family. Word of mouth is an effective way of promoting and raising awareness.

By promoting your event and cause across various channels, it will help you expand your reach, raise awareness, and encourage more people to participate in your fundraising activity.
